Try cleaning it out with a toothpick. I just cleaned mine out today and my headphones snap right in again. It helps if you break off a piece of the toothpick to make a sharper point.

If you have a custom rom that allows you to change the status bar colors you can achieve this affect by matching the colors. This app would help with that. https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.gits.cpicker

A guy was in the store buying a fake Christmas tree. The shop attendant asked him, "Are you going to put that tree up yourself?"
The guy replied, "Don't be disgusting! I'm going to put it in the living room!"

Link me: Display brightness.
It's the closest you can get to that feature, as far as I know. I didn't have a very good experience with the app, but it's worth a try.
Thanks. This is exactly the kind of advice I'm looking for.

Tiny Flashlight + LED requires some shady permissions. I recommend [Dashlight](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.spectrl.DashLight). It's a DashClock extension, but it can be used independently. The paid version comes with some pretty neat features.
[TeslaLed Flashlight](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.teslacoilsw.flashlight) is another option.
Really? What is it running now?
Thanks! I'll check them out. I called a couple places earlier today, including Fins and Foliage, and none of them have any plants.

[Auto-Wallpaper (for reddit)](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.autowallpaper.free) is great. You automatically get a wallpaper from a selected subreddit, at a selected time, with a set minimum resolution.

WRITING.TITLE: Looking for a 4.4 rom with OTG support.
WRITING.TEXT:
I just received my OTG Y-cable and I'm excited to try it out.
The only problem is that I'm having trouble finding a 4.4 rom with OTG support, so if you know of any roms please share. [I found a flashable .zip](http://forum.xda-developers.com/showthread.php?t=2181820) that enables OTG for 4.4, but it's "Most likely INCOMPATABLE with CM11", so if there aren't any roms with OTG support I'll have to settle with one that isn't based off of CM.
~~I'll also take any suggestions for custom recoveries.~~

The CyanogenMod calculator doesn't have this problem. It has everything the stock calculator app has, widgets (including lockscreen), graphing and more. You can also drag down the bar next to delete to view your history. [Play Store link.](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.android2.calculator3 hl=en)
Kansas City?
I use the [redditastic]( https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.blazeroni.reddit.widget) widget to view the comments of the images.

The CyanogenMod calculator is on the Play Store. It comes with a calculator lockscreen widget. [Link] (https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.android2.calculator3 )
